Unified Transfer Tax.definition: a tax imposed under the Internal Revenue Code on the cumulative total of gifts made over a certain amount by a person during his or her lifetime or after death called also unified estate and gift tax see also unified credit NOTE

1.1: a tax imposed under the Internal Revenue Code on the cumulative total of gifts made over a certain amount by a person during his or her lifetime or after death called also
1.note: The unified transfer tax system creates liability for a single tax rather than separate liability for a gift tax and an estate tax.
